title: "zed is a problem but only in really high elo"
body:
Meanwhile all of my master tier friends say he's not banned that often and say he's only worth picking in competitive because of 1-3-1 pushes or say he's shit in general.

Unless he's the new silver stomper (gonna say his winrate is 48% at best in silver without checking), idk why people still want him nerfed

also I main Kass before anybody wants to call me a Zed main.

replies.body:
The reason people want him still nerfed is that the AS nerfs really didn't hit his main problem. His main problem, people have been saying ALL ALONG, is his very safe waveclear, and his spammable skills which cost way less than other ninja's skills (35-40 energy less than Kennen and Akali at all levels, and 40-85 energy less than Shen). His get-out-of-jail-free ult is also somewhat of a problem, since Riot claims they want to encourage counterplay rather than risk-free engagements, though at least its damage can be mitigated or blocked with certain items. I'd like to see it reverted to its old form, when it created a second shadow right behind his enemy. More chance for damage, but no free escape. Sounds good for an assassin.

Back before mana regen nerfs, his waveclear was fine, because mid-lane mages could push just as hard. Now they can't. He used to be able to split push easily in addition to this, and while he still can split push fairly easily, the AS nerfs did slightly weaken that.

not really, Riot has defined an Assassin as someone who can get in, get a kill, and then get out. That's why almost all assassins except for like Talon, have an escape. The reason Riot considers Zed a healthy assassin is because he can do just that while also having several weaknesses. Yes he has a strong laning phase, but his teamfight sucks and he is easily countered by several items, champions, and summoner spells. I will admit his waveclear can be problematic in lane, but if he didn't have that then I think his laning phase would be sub par.

> Assassin as someone who can get in, **get a kill, and then get out. ** That's why almost all assassins except for like Talon, have an escape.

I'd agree. But Zed (and also Leblanc) can get out even if they don't get that kill. That's the difference. And it's because their gap-closer moves also allow them to retreat instantly any time in the next 6 (or 4, for LB) seconds for no additional cost. Kat and Akali use their gap-closer and then they don't get a charge or a reset back unless they get a kill. So they can be punished if they miscalculate.

>  if he didn't have that then I think his laning phase would be sub par.

That's how assassins work. They usually have crappy laning phases because they roam and get kills. This is why their waveclear is usually either on a high-mana cost move (Talon's Rake, Leblanc's Distortion) or requires them to use their gap-closer on minions.
Marry me.

Compare Zed to Fizz. Everyone hates Fizz. How much harder is it for Fizz to lane and wave clear as opposed to Zed? Much harder. His escape is tied in with his only AOE skill. His last hitting requires him to melee range and doesn't have Zed's passive or AD to get insanely easy last hits. Zed has a free range/poke/farm skill in his Q. Fizz again, doesn't have this. All of his kit requires him to put himself in a bad position. Also a few uses of his E will put him oom. Zed has all these free laning tools as an assassin when an assassin should have a crappy laning phase like Fizz.
hmm but notice that Fizz's teamfight is better than Zed's.

How so? I don't value Fizz's teamfight above Zed's in the slightest. If your shark hits someone there's plenty of time for enemies to disperse from that area so the AOE from his ult is very situational. Zed's teamfight AOE isn't even bad since shadow W still does a lot of damage, his Q goes through infinite enemies. Fizz has single target damage on his Q and W. His E while AOE is his only escape and usually saved to get back out.
